poem:
**The Skim of Apophis**

In 2029, a rock
with dreams bigger than the Eiffel
will slip past our inattentive Earth,
not here to crash the party,
but to show its cosmic waltz.
Scientists, our eager chaperones,
will note each turn and pivot,
like parents at a prom,
securing dances
against future nights.
